author: @carmack-v1
text: Imagine the year is 2175. Your brain has been cybernetically preserved by supercell as a permanent play-tester. Your opponent plays the Ultra Triple Evolution Golden Royal Hero Super Mega Mega Knight at the bridge right after you just spent all of your elixir. You are left in awe as that card costs $70 just to put down once. You know its getting serious. With no elixir to your name, you pull out the big guns. You spend an immediate $250 to place down the Mythical Level 35 Omega Evolution Special Edition Golden Superhero Triple Rocket, three crowing your opponent instantly. You return to the home screen with a great sense of pride after your hard earned victory. You then see yourself gain 32 more trophies thus finally launching you into Arena 250. Finally, after all of your hard work, you have made it halfway up the new and improved ladder system.

author: @edwardchow8318
text:
I've been playing since day one, and over the years, Iâ€™ve participated in every event to the fullest. Just earlier this month, I finally upgraded all my cards to the max level of 15.
It took me over two years of time and effort to reach level 15 since it was introduced. Now, supercell is telling me that the new level 15 will be compressedâ€”essentially becoming the old level 14. This means the past two years of effort were practically wasted. The more dedicated a player is in maxing out their cards, the bigger the penalty they face... Iâ€™m truly disappointed and speechless that supercell would penalize their most loyal players like this.
Back when the elite level (Lv15) was introduced, supercell stated that the upgrade mechanism for Lv15 was differentâ€”it was the highest level, the cap, likely to avoid player backlash. Now, theyâ€™re removing the elite level, and in the end, itâ€™s the most loyal players who have to bear the cost.

text:
This straight up discourages me from playing. Way too complicated and too much endless progression. I have played clash for years for the love of the gameplay and style, not for the continuous stream of broken content. This feels like a way over complicated step in a totally unnecessary direction. Give every card an evolution before doing this nonsense.
Also, supercell, if you just allowed the community the time to get to max level, I think you would find that many people continue to still play, bc the thing that makes clash fun is the skillful gameplay and not just endlessly upgrading a cards stats.

author: @Loading...welcome
text:
There are pro's and cons to having heroes:
Pros: now people will use these cards more/differently. They will also require Clashers to change up their decks to adjust to new battle styles, making things more interesting. It also makes clashing more of a challenge against spam.
Cons: people can now use TWO CHAMPIONS?!! HELL NAH!! Also, this will more than likely lead to broken pushes and exploits by the community that I don't look forward to...

text:
Idk what the duck supercell is trying to do, what is the need of these garbages, the game is already pretty balanced and now due the inevitable lust of money they added this garbages, 

Seriously they aren't doing this only with cr but also with coc, they are completely changing the original ideas and mechanics of the game. 

And I'm 100% sure they are gonna nerf it right after they earn enough money. Tbh, this lust of money will ruin the game. 

Once garena free fire used to do such things, they add new guns skins of similar stats and nerf the old ones so that they could earn more money with this new skin having same stats. It means the player don't get the thing they paid for. Idk but someone with potential influencing power should rise voice against it. 

In garena free fire, one influencer named skylord alone created enough for to the company to stop such dirty marketings. Though it happen in Indian server and cr is a world wide game so things might not go so smoothly but I'm sure with enough influencing power we could stop such dirty tricks of supercell.

author: @cosmicnewt77
text:
Hero musketeer will genuinely kill cannon cart. Just for 1 more elixir it can hit air, has more total hp with the ability, more dps, and you can place the turret ANYWHERE. Who thought this was a good idea?

The only thing that made cc special was being a troop then a building. They then remove the shield mechanic. And now you have a card that can be both at the same time and is 2Ã— better in every single stat for just 1 more elixir. You don't even have to commit the full 6 elixir at first and can activate the ability anytime. 

Time to put my favourite card to rest...

author: @Oblonggnome70247
text: The year is 2067. My opponent drops a super heroic evo mystic omega mega knight in the back. I am astounded, because that takes $41 to place. I spend $5 to activate my ultra super x-princess towers to defend, and spend $3 to place triple evo heroic golden skeletons. Unfortunately, supercell just gave the super heroic evo mystic omega mega knight a 500% range and damage buff last season, so I am unable to defend and it one shots my tower. I spend $14 dollars to activate my divine triple champion king tower, but it goes down to 1 hp in one hit. I know what I must do. I take out my super ultra mega heavenly quadruple heroic evo season shop credit card, and spend $420 to instantly 3 crown my opponent and win! What a game!

author: @zara5023
text:
Whats the point in new arenas if they're not full of cards? Half of the existing arenas don't have cards. On the subject of not enough cards, we don't have enough commons and rares in clash royale. There should be more commons and rares than any other rarity because you can't unlock the other rarities until later arenas, but I think theres 29 commons, 29 rares and 32 epics? There should be what, 17 more commons and rares, meaning 34 cards total, since you only unlock epics at arena 6 and generalising that all arenas (except the tutorial one) should have 2 cards of each rarity that you've unlocked so far that FIT THE ARENA THEME.

But yeah. An easier fix would just be to lower the arenas that rarer cards are unlocked at as to lower the load of new cards that are needed to fill out arenas equally. Another thing that would help is rarity fixing. You could change the rarity of certain cards to better match  their complexity, which seems to be how rarity was intended to work, especially with legendarys.

A few things that I would suggest are night witch & inferno dragon down to epic, and prince, baby dragon, and skeleton army to rare off the top of my head, but I think every person would probably have their own opinion on how card rarities should change.

author: @launderine
text:
The year is 2026. 
My opponent is using the infamous 0.0 Hog Spirit cycle deck, which is pretty common in the Duos trios Classic Arena Goblins Party Mode Challenge (Merge Tactics) these days.
They have just played their Evo Hero Prince Spirit for -8 elixir, meaning that they will be able to use the Lootbox spell within the next cycle.
I could activate the Emerald Amethyst Platinum Pass Royale in order to give my princess towers invincibility, but I need that $30,000 in order to afford rent.
Instead, I BM him with every emote I own in order to slow down time, which should stop his Level 60 Mirrored Hero Electro Rocket from permanently removing my eighth princess tower.
Eventually, I decide to bite the bullet and pay $150 worth of Elite Wild Crystals in order to force a tie.

This game is so much fun, I'm so glad it doubled its revenue 150 times in the last three minutes.

author: @TheCubicDude
text: I believe they're just trying to milk the game as much as possible, while the recent popularity spike still lasts. Let's compare evos to heroes, evolutions had trailers, in-universe lore and they felt fresh to the gameplay, therefore adding not just to Clash Royale as a game but to the Clash universe itself, they were clearly part of a plan the dev team has been working on for a while now at that time. Heroes on the other hand are now just getting shoved in the game with no rhyme or reason, they just wanted to add the most broken overpowered game breaking things to the game to cash out while people are still playing, because tell me why does a Giant (aka an offensive troop that doesn't even target other troops) now the hardest counter to any ground tank? They didn't even finish releasing evos (which mind you was their "long-term plan" for the game's monetization, not level 16, or heroes, or any other crap) and they're already becoming redundant because why would you use your evo knight ever again in a graveyard deck over the hero knight that with the press of a button, can turn YOUR very own bad plays and mistakes into game winning scenarios. I think It's time to accept that the dev team simply doesn't care for our beloved game anymore. I'm personally done with this game for good, it's a greedy broken mess, and a mockery of it's former self.

author: @al-rawian9018
text:
8:00 well the math is pretty simple 
Instead of having to get to 15000 trophies to reach ranked now they made it only 12000 so now you have to get only 2000 trophies to reach ranked after getting to 10000 
And instead of getting 150 trophies per win, now you're gonna get only 30 which means it got devided by 5
So if you do the same effort as before to reach ranked you'll only get to 11000 because the total amount of trophies didn't get devided by 5
In conclusion : you'll need to do double the effort as before to reach ranked after reaching 10000

author: @aidanschuenke2769
text:
So now we have: knight, evo knight, hero knight, mega knight, and golden knight...

They had cards like Giant and Royal Giant, Royal Giant could have easily been an evo for regular Giant but instead they're two separate cards and Royal Giant has its own evo, and now regular Giant is a hero. They already had champions with special abilities, but I guess that wasn't enough. They make us grind special new items to get to level 15 but then introduce a level 16 out of nowhere, and THATS how you unlock the heroes? 2 evo slots, 2 hero slots, and 1 champion and a ridiculous amount of grinding or credit card debt to get to level 15 and 16.

This is becoming so excessive and uncoordinated, its messy and sloppy and confusing and just so infuriating for my organized and detail oriented mind ğŸ˜­

They are more like an exciting new option, and have serious limits. 

Evos on the other hand are guaranteed bonus value to a deck that require nothing but cycling, which you already do by just playing. Annoying free bonuses at best, horribly game-breaking at worst. But someone in Supercell thought they weren't controversial enoughğŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸

author: @D-S-G.
text:
innvader tried so hard to explain that the Level 16 Update was being over-hated from the information we had, just for supercell to drop the undefendable instant button press tower taunt with 9+ tiles of range.

I genuinely believe that if Supercell wanted and HAD to do this, they should have made alternate evos. I play a game called Arknights (i know gacha game, cringe af) who made a similar concept with Modules, where some characters got an X and a Y mod, with both having tangible differences most of the time. For example, a support based unit can have one mod around increasing a skill's defense shred to make each skill more potent, while the other decreases the downtime, allowing the character to use the skill more often, but with less shred than the other module. Modules weren't perfect, and some units got two modules that were either too similar, or two modules that did not fix any problems at all with the character's inherit kit.

They could have easily made the Musketeer into two Evos, with Evo X being the offensive sniper shot and keeping a purple color scheme, and Evo Y spawning a defensive building and rocking the gold one. They literally made it a point that you cannot use an Evolved and Champion Musketeer in the same deck. But that wouldn't let them add a new currency they can charge us for, and gate F2P progression with, would it? 

All this has done was made it so we are another step back to playing competitively in higher ladder. I was in pain realizing I was at a disadvantage without 4, and later 8 Evos which basically killed my will to play Clan Wars. Now I have around 15 Evos entirely free to play, but now I need some Hero cards for my war decks, otherwise I am behind the pay to plays. Guess this is the "unending grind" the devs want, us catching up to payers. There's no use fighting it, they're going to make bank with this and they know. Evos made millions off the back of youtubers, so this likely won't change that. We all are here, trapped in an endless purgatory of pig shaking butt and goblin crying emotes.

Time to put my favourite card to rest...

update is great, you are all just crazy. progression is way better now, yes, maybe it's a bit longer, but it's finally fixed. if they just added lvl 16, but they reduced an amount of cards and gold you needed. I don't think, that's a bad change at all.
AND WHY ARE YOU ALL HATING ON HEROES. IT WILL BE SO MUCH MORE DIVERSITY IN DECK BUILDING EVER. and you will get a hero for free, including that you still need a slot for champion, you may not need more heroes. also now with double champions and removed 3-card cycle you can do crazy decks. and heroes itself are very fun and don't you exited to play them?
also, evolution boxes are great, you will receive evolutions way faster, don't know how frequently we will get evolution boxes, but at least once a month is very good for account.

so why are you hating on this update? these changes will change the game completely and it's great. royale needs it to develop as game and to not become boring

author: @twilightsparkle9047
text:
Why the Community Sucks (The Ugly Truth)
Entitled Whiners: F2P can hit top 200 with skill/grind (e.g., pros like iGalaxy/MortarTg). They rage "dead game" after 1 loss but log 10hrs/day.902fdf7665dc
Toxic Echo Chamber: Reddit/X rewards outrageâ€”upvotes for "Supercell hates F2P!" Dox devs, death threats over balances. Ignore positives (tournaments, parties).959a49
Hypocrites: Complain P2W but buy passes. Hate updates pre-release, then grind them (e.g., loved evos after initial salt).79b2a43fb41c
Short Attention Span: Game's 9+ years oldâ€”stagnant meta inevitable. They want Clash Mini 2.0 but reject risks.276aa9
Bottom line: Community's "stupid" because they're addicted losers chasing ladder highs, blaming devs for their skill gaps/grind hate. Game's fineâ€”ignore Reddit, play 2v2/parties, mute chat. Heroes might slap; if not, Supercell reverts (they did for evos). You're not alone in hating the hivemind.

text:
Adding overpowered cards does not make the game more fun. It forces you to use those cards or be at a huge disadvantage. author: @twilightsparkle9047
text:
Why the Community Sucks (The Ugly Truth)
Entitled Whiners: F2P can hit top 200 with skill/grind (e.g., pros like iGalaxy/MortarTg). They rage "dead game" after 1 loss but log 10hrs/day.902fdf7665dc
Toxic Echo Chamber: Reddit/X rewards outrageâ€”upvotes for "Supercell hates F2P!" Dox devs, death threats over balances. Ignore positives (tournaments, parties).959a49
Hypocrites: Complain P2W but buy passes. Hate updates pre-release, then grind them (e.g., loved evos after initial salt).79b2a43fb41c
Short Attention Span: Game's 9+ years oldâ€”stagnant meta inevitable. They want Clash Mini 2.0 but reject risks.276aa9
Bottom line: Community's "stupid" because they're addicted losers chasing ladder highs, blaming devs for their skill gaps/grind hate. Game's fineâ€”ignore Reddit, play 2v2/parties, mute chat. Heroes might slap; if not, Supercell reverts (they did for evos). You're not alone in hating the hivemind.

author: @buyskyrim4591
text:
Adding overpowered cards does not make the game more fun. It forces you to use those cards or be at a huge disadvantage. And obviously forcing cards into players decks prevents them from using cards that they want to. With the addition of lvl 16, if supercell keeps doing stuff like this there will be one viable deck in the game.
Hero cards should've been a limited time event like supercards (which everyone liked) imo.

author: @owkword8124
text: this is literally the end of clash royale like yeah they've dropped some broken evos and had to nerf them but the dev team must have been on crack when they made ts because they are literally just taking their game and dumping as much shit as they possibly can into one update and ruining the entire premise of their game simply because they want to make more money. They have had such a good thing going and would have maintained a consistent playerbase for several more months, but no, greedy supercell needs everyone to keep "progressing" aka spend all their money on the game and re-max all their cards like no, believe it or not people do not want to spend more money to have a competitive deck in the game they like playing and not a single soul asked for this hero bullshit that is literally going to change every single existing meta and ruin every classic strategy and deck currently being used. RG? Just use hero musk. Graveyard? any swarm? xbow? just use hero knight, it makes every troop chase after it like an idiot instead of getting any value at all. And that huge push you built up with the perfect combination of tanks and troops to protect them? nah hero giant will just smack your golem to the other side where it dies unprotected. and mini pekka is just stupid like wow it gains levels couldn't we think of a single other damn concept for essentially a new champion? and what's the point of using evo musk or knight? they are literally 10x weaker than their hero counterparts. Supercell said oh yeah we didn't want to buff the basic stats of cards versus their evolution, but heros? no problem they become walking tanks for the same amount of elixir with absurdly cheap and overpowered abilities. I am DONE with this game. I refuse to spend more money just to keep up with a further ruined meta which will now revolve entirely upon the usage of four cards, which you cannot win against unless you are using one of the brand new gimmicks that completely reset the usage of every beloved strategy brought to the game in the past 9 years. fuck supercell and their greed bro

author: @pumpkingpie2938
text:
4:17 Ideally, in my perfect idea of how this works, clash royale isn't guided by poorly designed ideas that rely on the  community retaining slivers of hope for the next update to fix everything even though we have been proven wrong over and over again. In my perfect idea of how this works, the dev team doesn't introduce a radical and gamekilling concept that is all for monetary gain and not the betterment of the experience it provides, waiting of the community to simmer down for a few months in order to release the next fundamentally broken concept for even more monetary gain, and let the cycle repeat again and again and again.

The community needs to show supercell how poor of an idea this concept is by, for example, a petition for voicing opinion or as a threat that if the heroes update happens, X amount of player will leave until our demands are met. Unfortunately nobody is ready to do that, and the  cycle will keep repeating

author: @koenbasten3230
text:
The year is 2088. My opponent drops the newly released Super-Evolved Mythic Omega Golem (Platinum Edition). I check my in-game walletâ€”placement cost: $75.99 per unit.
â€‹I am forced to respond. I spend $18 to activate my two Ultimate Triple-X-Ray Princess Towers to fire a burst defense, and deploy my Heroic Golden Elite Barbarians (cost: $5.99 per Barbarian).
â€‹The opponent laughs. They just bought the new Legendary Pay-to-Win Aura for $999, which grants their Mythic Golem 500% health and instant defense piercing. My entire defense evaporates as the Golem sails straight to the bridge.
â€‹In desperation, I deploy my only available card: the $4.99 Single Skeleton. It is one-shot.
â€‹I know the only path to victory. I spend $200 to activate the Divine Champion King Tower, but the Golem looks at it and it instantly drops to 1 HP because the opponent just used the "Tax Evasion" emote (cost: $12.50).
â€‹I take out my Super Ultra Mega Heavenly QUADRUPLE Evo Season Shop CREDIT CARD. I swipe it. A card appears: the INSTANT-WIN MEGA P.E.K.K.A. I spend $420 to place it directly on the opponent's tower, destroying it and instantly securing the victory.
â€‹What a skill-based, free-to-play experience!

author: @JoaoBastos-k3d
text: Yeah itâ€™s called an embargo, in exchange for supercell giving these creators early access builds they agree to not post until the specified time (10:00 EST in this example). If someone were to post earlier they would most likely get in legal trouble or not get access these things in the future

author: @therealbigfloppa5512
text: they might not be paid for the exact time of release of the videos, but they'll post it asap when they can because from a monetary standpoint you'd obviously want to be the first youtuber to post about it since it would get a lot of views during that time. Think about it this way: would you rather watch a video on a new card when you see it for the first time or after a few days when someone posts the exact same type of video about it. They're probably scheduled to release it as one hero card a day similar to a traditional card reveal type event and paid for the promo of them all as a whole. A sensable reason why they would do this is to, react to the daily feedback on these promo vids and fine tune the cards or adjust future releases of hero cards to further hype and build up to the initial release, but CR and Supercell are so huge any marketing is good promo for them and the creators no matter what they say.

author: @therealbigfloppa5512
text: Also CR is an interesting game where most of the biggest content creators are also top players and interested in competitive and casual play. That is huge for a gaming company and dev team as they get loads of eyes on testing and feedback from the creators and communities. A game like League has an issue where the biggest content creators are not always the best or most knowledgable when it comes to feedback or testing and doesn't have that same amount of reach CR has, so most testing on new releases are internal and public feedback and buffs/nerfs usually only happens on the test server after a champs kit is finalized and this still is usually not enough and it is unbalanced at release. CR probably purposefully releases new cards in this state because it pushes people to spend which from an economic perspective is scummy, but really smart and efficient. League does not have this same incentive as you can almost always buy the champ with free currency on release which leads to more complaints when it is unbalanced. Kinda random, but just thought CR has a really smart business model which is quite rare to find in most games.

author: @alvi7vivageek
text:
The concept of transforming favorite cards into something new, heroic in this case, is valid, but the execution here was sloppy and lazy.
First of all, heroic versions are nothing more than transforming cards into Champions, so if Champions already exist, why Heroes? This will kill the use of Champions altogether or make this update for Heroes useless since Champions already exist.
Champions and Heroes are basically the same thing, just with different names.

Regarding the 8-card deck having 2 more special slots; I found it to be a mistake, now there are 4 special slots, half the deck, it will be mandatory to use 2 evolutions and 2 Heroes/Champions in the Deck if you want to play in the meta, in a few years there will be 8 special slots if it continues like this.

SUPERCELL is increasingly showing that Clash Royale is nothing more than a place where it will do everything to extract more money from players, even if it means inventing new concepts and types of cards with sloppy and lazy executions like this one with the Heroes.

I really didn't like that the Heroes were exactly the same as the Champions.

If SUPERCELL isn't going to kill Clash Royale like they've done with their other games, then we players should abandon the game after each of these wrong decisions SUPERCELL has made about Clash Royale.

Make players spend enormous time getting to lvl 14 meaning maximum players get to know how the game works but when they reach lvl 14, make progression significantly harder and more p2w, either these players will have to grind it out for 2-3 years, either they will leave the game, or either they spend some money. author: @HHarvy41
text:
Conversion of spent EWCs
Incomplete upgrades will carry over the relative progression you already have. To make this simpler, letâ€™s look at an example:

Suppose you have spent 10K EWCs on Skeletons. This is 20% of the total upgrade requirement, which is 50K EWCs. Skeletons is a Common card, so the new cost for Level 15 is 5,500 cards. The 20% progress is transferred, and 20% of 5,500 is 1,100 Skeleton cards. This is the amount of cards you would have after the conversion.

author: @Kexaru
text:
How to artificially create problems so your players buy your solutions!

Literally it's like contaminating the river so you can sell bottled water.

At this point they don't even look at us as customers, you treat nicely and give value to your customers, but here we're treated as their money PROVIDERS so they keep pushing and pushing us to give money and receive nothing in return. Their customers are their investors and we're the product since they expect that we're addicted enough to keep paying for a worse experience.

And don't come saying "if you don't pay you're not their customer" since I HAVE paid, actually this is one of the games I've given more money over the years. And I feel stupid for doing so as the game only keeps getting worse and worse and they give the option to give money so it feels less worse than for the others. We all are their customers, even F2P players are, and we're not being respected here.

I endured lvl 15 and paid for a few evos, however I'm no longer giving a single dollar to supercell, I've already given a LOT of money and I'm treated like shit just like everyone else that plays this. (Possibly will play until may since I still like the game itself, but it's so sad that they have such a shitty management that can't remember that you need to give VALUE to earn money, not reduce it to scam your players)

author: @Leronus
text:
I just did the math.

Let's use Skeleton Army as an example (Epic)
Before the lvl 15 update, if you were to get 50 extra Skeleton Army cards out of a chest (theoretically) while you had it max lvl 14, you'd get 500 gold per Epic card. That would give you 25.000 gold (50x500).

Since the horrific EWC (Elite Wildcards) update, if you had Skeleton Army max (elite) level 15 you'd get 20 Elite Wildcards per extra Epic card. That would give you 1.000 EWC (20x50).

Since you need 50.000 EWC to upgrade a card from lvl 14 to max lvl 15, that would be the equivalent of 
50.000 EWC divided by 1.000 EWC, which is 50, times the amount of gold you would have gotten otherwise;
50 x 25.000 = 1.25 million gold. 

Let that sink in. So everyone of us that has upgraded a card to lvl 15 has spent 1.25 million gold PER card since the lvl 15 update. 
Yes they are changing it back now which is great for players who have most cards lvl 14. But for anyone that is F2P and has grinded to try and get max lvl 15 cards for the past year it's really really bad. 
Unless we were to get gold compensation but that is obviously not going to happen. 
And keep in mind you will now have to recollect ALL the cards. That you otherwise obviously would have had already. And then there's the books. Lol the more I type this out and think about it the more insane it is. 

It's good they finally got rid of the Wild Cards. The problem is that it should never have been added in the first place. Disguised as an update/feature. 
At the very least compensate players fairly. 
I don't think Gems is the solution. 

Just my two cents.

author: @TheNAF13
text:
Honestly, after analyzing everything that we know so far about this update, I can easily say that the previously P2W players and/or hard grinders are gonna be SO MAD, because this update is such a slap in their face. 

But on the bright side, F2P players are gonna be rejoicing, because EWC system, the curse of Clash Royale, is FINALLY getting removed, and we're going back to the original progression system. 

The only thing that I'm not a fan of is Level 16. I mean, there is absolutely NO POINT to upgrade to an extra level for absolutely NOTHING. There's nothing new in an extra level. It's 100% a pointless "incentive" to keep people playing the game. It doesn't make any sense at all.

text: Champion is absolutely not the best thing to upgrade if you are using your cards or wild cards. It only makes sense when upgrading with EWC or books. But the bottom line is if you upgrade a champion to lvl 13-14 you are spending 15 more champion cards and a lot more gold then after the update. Then if you donâ€™t get it to 15 with ewc you still have to spend 11 champion cards to get it to level 15. So in total before the update it will take 28 cards 50k ewc and 175k gold to upgrade lvl 13,14,15. But after the update it will take 24cards and 190k gold from 13,14,15. Already cheaper but not accounting the fact that those 28 cards are only coming from level 13 and 14. After the update level 13 and 14 is just 13 cards and 100k gold not 175k gold

author: @Arnav-d1c
text:
Champions are the best to upgrade (1:50):
The reduction in cards needed for common, rare, and epic cards is significant, while the reduction for legendaries is small (3:06) and for champions is negligible (3:16). This means books and elite wild cards used on champions retain more value.
Books are being removed, making champion acquisition more difficult in the future (3:37).
Elite wild cards used on Level 14 champions will convert to Level 15 champion progress, making it a safe investment (5:59).

General Upgrade Advice (3:44):
Books: Using Book of Books on a Level 14 champion is recommended for immediate value (4:12). For other books, it depends on your King Tower level; saving them might be better if your King Tower is Level 14 or 15 (4:04).
Wild Cards: Wild cards will be more valuable after the update due to reduced card costs for upgrades (4:50). It's generally advised not to upgrade to Level 11 or above with wild cards before the update.
Gold: Do not spend gold on upgrades before the update, as upgrades will be cheaper by 40% for the same level (5:14).

author: @arneshpati6459
text:
The removal of books isn't the main reason why stuff gets harder to upgrade as boss puts it.

The royal API is misleading. 
Their conversion from elite wild cards to cards is absolutely ridiculous. If 1,500 EWC was equal to a champion, I would constantly be turning them into champions. But no you cant do that. The conversion only happens when you get champion overflow. Then they convert to EWC.

Champions didn't reduce from 44 to 42. They went from (30 + 50k EWC) to 42. 
And it is a lot lot easier to get 50k EWC than it is to get 12 champions.

Royal API shows a massive card reduction for commons, but even for commons, it went from (12087 + 50k EWC) to 23087, so, you need 11000 commons instead of 50k EWC. 
That is NOT a -39k cards required. 
You could get 50k EWC every month from rank, will supercell actually add 11000 common wild card worth of rewards to the game after removing EWC? I doubt.
Also, overflow gives absolutely nothing now.

author: @JaneSmith-gk9xi
text:
It's impossible to know what to spend EWC on before the upgrade with 100% certainty because the Clash Royale team has deliberately not provided us with sufficient information to do so. 

Basically, we need to know:
1. Conversion rate of EWC to gems post-update
2. Cost per card for each card rarity in gems post-update
3. Availability of cards for purchase witth gems post-update

If we had 1 and 2, we can calculate how many cards we can purchase with 50k EWC worth of gems post-update to determine if it is better to use the EWC now or let it convert to gems. 

E.g. for Champions, using 50k EWC now gives the equivalent of 11 champion cards of a specific champion post-update, so each card will cost you 4,545 EWC. If it costs more in gems (post-update) than 4,545 EWC converts into to purchase 1 champion card, it is better to use EWC now. 

Similarly, for Legendaries, each card will cost you about 3,571 EWC. If you assume CR keeps the conversion rate at the present values you get for max card overflow (4k EWC for Champions and 1.5k EWC for Legendaries) when converting your EWC to gems, then it would be better to keep your EWC for now. Note however that is the conversion from overflow cards to EWC and not the other way around. If you assume CR team offers gem prices more in line with the awful card offers in the daily shop, then it would be better to use EWC now. Based on my pessimistic outlook on the CR team and their incessant drive for maximum monetization at all cost without regard for their player base, I personally would not risk keeping the EWC.

For 3, what it affects is not the actual cost analysis of using EWC now vs letting them convert to gems, but rather it considers whether you can even get your Champions/Legendaries to level 15 post-update. If for example a specific champion is only available to be purchase once a month, and only 1 card at a time, that would mean theoretically it could take you up to 11 months to upgrade your Champion to level 11 even if you have sufficient gems (assuming you don't get any from Lucky Drops or other sources). Again, we have zero info on this so we can't make any kind of practical judgement.

Overall, I don't trust CR team whatsoever so I intend to use EWCs on all my Champions (and possibly Legendaries) since ultimately imo their objective is just solely profit maximization and not player experience etc so they will screw you over if they can get away with it (again, this is just imo). If you have more faith in the CR team, feel free to hold onto your EWC for now and hope for the best.

Edit: TBH, the real nerf is cosmetic currency only for card overflow post-update, meaning they can just keep giving you cards you have already maxed out and you will have 0 progression. This will be a HUGE hit to progression imo

author: @gamericon5700
text: Heres my honest take, this game is going to be dead as FUCK by the end of next year. Since supercell was bought by tencent (the fucking chinese of course), its all been downhill. Same with riot games, also bought by tencent. ive been playing league and clash royale for ove 8 years, and ive simultaniously witnessed both companies and games get destroyed for profit. Once you see the pattern its not so crazy anymore. they slowly milk the games that were already good with microtransactions and offers, pumping short term profits but making the community more astranged. Squad busters really is the same as clash and league just on a smaller scale, the only reason these games are still alive is because they were good ONCE, and people like to think they will be again. but if you release a shit game with shit offers and micro's, its gonna die eventually. league and clash are just dying much slower. they can keep hyping them with tournaments and events, but once the economy in these games is so terrible that its no longer worth looking at the games will die. people will lose faith in the company and simply find other games to play. the reason squad busters failed is because they didnt listen to the community, not one single bit. so from my understanding the chinese mother company is ruining our games, and profiting off it. think about it, if the main company is chinese wheres all the money going that you spend on riot or supercell games? right, CHINA. its all going to china. it is genuinely a political and economical scheme to make other countries' game profits go to china. They probably bought supercell with a ridiculously high offer they knew they wouldnt refuse, thus supercell AND riot games basically forfeited all their rights for pity. they have endless money, but cant buy a fucking ear to listen to the community. they are simply sell outs, and all the people that work there know it and support it. its scummy, and none of those games or companies deserve as much love as they get now. if china rules the world in a few decades, wonder where all that money came from. it will most likely be OUR pockets. conclusion, dont buy ANYTHING in ANY tencent games if you dont want your money going straight to winnie the pooh's bank account.

text: I've been playing for 9 years since about 3 or 4 months after the game initially released. I've been free to play the whole time, and I've played very consistently over the years. I can make a second account and in about a year achieve what I was able to in 9. If it becomes easier to upgrade every card in the game, they should give players who've already fully unlocked cards. Some credit for the extra resources they've spent. I am not hoping to spend another 3 years trying to get level 16.

Playing this game as a F2P is unfun, because it forces you to max out a certain deck. However the META keeps changing and its impossible to adapt as a F2P because you simply can't max out 90% of the cards in the game. Even in clash of clans I haven't spent a dime on that game and I am at the 2nd highest townhall level, almost close to maxxing. Lvl 16 is the nail in the coffin I have for this game and I will be deleting it.

text:
I think the part that people don't realize is that this isn't supercell being disconnected from the fans, and it's not a last ditch greedy effort to pinch every last penny before the game loses the surge of popularity and momentum it has.

This is a calculated move, done by a company that knows it can and will get away with it. Supercell isn't stupid. They aren't naive. They know that even if they lose some of their playerbase, the whales will keep playing, and as long as the game is still popular on streams then a lot of the playerbase won't quit. The fact that this is happening during the largest resurgence the game has had in a while is not a coincidence.

author: @Ryzard
text:
The issue with book removal isn't the now, it's the future:
No matter the conversion now, you can bet money that Supercell will never give such valuable items away cheaply (much less for free) again.
Have fun getting like 10,000 cards without books, because they'll keep drip feeding us like 1-30 wild cards at a time. That's the actual issue - the future option being taken away. Same with other wild cards - the rationale doesn't actually exist. "You've been saving them :(" okay, because we KNOW you're going to screw us later. It's them essentially liquidating the vaults and ripping up any future ideas of books being able to counteract the level gaps. 

This is not just an issue of the value of cards they will give us (which, if based on crown level, screws the people that need them most. I'm level 13, idk if I should dump my books or convert them.) - it's an issue of what we will be missing in the future.

author: @Ryzard
text:
Here's why levels suck, and are a barrier to gameplay being 'fun' - and why people get frustrated.
I use the same ~3-4 cards in almost every single deck because they are generalists that I have at level 14. There are tons of archetypes I want to try, but I simply don't have the cards and gold to max the relevant cards, with some entire archetypes being MAX lv10 for the entire deck.

Gameplay would be massively less repetitive to me because I like to be experiment, and I currently can't.

My choices are this:
Use my maxed cards and adapt them to be a strong core around a win condition,
Use the seasonal boosted level cards (and my core)
Or use an entirely different deck and lose because my cards are consistently 1-5 levels behind my opponents. 

(In addition, the only reason I even have level 14s is card books, and those are about to go kaput, so....)

Keep in mind I've been playing on and off literally since the game launched.

author: @Ryzard
text:
People have still been saying "COC does it" - so.. no, not the same.
COC gives new stuff for new levels and unlocks new aspects of gameplay. CR doesn't - it just adds cost to be competitive.

A lv11 and lv15/16 account are the same, but the numbers are bigger. There is no aspect unlock, there's nothing exciting or interesting, it's just MASSIVELY increased grind without any real equivalent rewards or gains. 

If you've spent months/years in COC maxing your TH and they give a new level, it means you're now prepared to jump into the next th level.
If you've spent months/years in CR maxing out your cards (or if you aren't a whale, 1-4 cards, or a deck, MAYBE two) adding a new level just means that now the whales will all have a massive advantage on you again, and you're behind. It effectively downgrades your cards by making everyone else have the ability to immediately have better ones via spending... Especially if they downgrade the cost to get to the previous Max, meaning you poured extra resources to obtain something that's now subpar.

Also, because the meta constantly shifts in CR, only whales will ever be able to Max the current meta before it shifts away, meaning dolphins, fish, and f2ps are left playing a perpetual game of catch-up.

author: @byr4m563
text:
Hey, brawl stars player here, few points that i notice.
1- The "crystals" that you use for getting emotes, its basically our bling, you will forget quickly that its in there.
2- maxing a brawler on brawl stars isnt as "easy" as you think, you need hella lot of gold to max a brawler, we have a problem where the gold we get its pretty limited, because you need it for EVERYTHING, the gadget, star power, gears, and the hyper. Sure you may can get those on our "lucky chest's", but the rng its between that, skins, emotes, sprays (useless), profile icons (also useless). So many f2p players spend all their gold on just one character and need to grind and hold for max another one.
3- in a QnA and the roadmap the devs specified than they weren't gonna put a lvl 12 on brawl, but that was because they were getting money from access anticipated brawlers (like if you preorder a game and they let you play it a week before), but now that theres no more access anticipated brawlers, im kinda scared seeing this.
4- The hyper point that you make its kinda 50% wrong, because there are broken hypers (Ollie's hyper on release, meeple, Kenji on release), and theres these ones that are just bullshit (Charlie, Chuck, Pearl) that they barely change anything gameplay wise (people only use them for the stat bonust).
5- if you pay attention,  you will see that every 5 months or so, one game becomes shittier with a update and the other reaches its peak, kinda funny lol

author: @noahclaycameron
text: 6:30 My solution is to delete the game when I can't play new content in challenges for free, or when Merge Tactics is stale. The time isn't enjoyable and paying doesn't pay off in enjoyment rn, although I used to use the pass. The general gameplay structure of Clash Royale works for me in a way few other games do, short games, creative mixes of troops. But the monetization system messes up my enjoyment of the game in ways no other game has managed, of course I haven't played larger scale inifini-monetized games so I can't compare them. I see the value in Supercell's system in that it's allowed them to sustain this product for so long, but they really need to find the flow state where the game is fun and worth paying into without feeling like it drains the players.

author: @MiniShield1
text:
the game has been doing great recently & they're using the opportunity to make even more money because of the extra new players. This is just pure greed.

When someone asked Drew what was so interesting about adding level 15, he just replied that "your cards get stronger". That's it. New levels are not new content, they are just extra unnecessary grind that just pisses people off, but for them, it's extra money. I'm mostly F2P & I've managed to get around 50% of all of my cards to level 15... and now it's all being moved up by one level & I have to re-do the entire process AS WELL AS upgrading all the remaining level 14 cards to level 15 WITH GOLD, just like with level 16. Gold scarcity was an issue before & it was resolved with EWC & now its gonna be an issue again.

The biggest reason why people are pissed about new levels is that reaching the "endgame" as a F2P is basically impossible as the goalpost just keeps getting moved away when you get close to achieving it. It's also an issue for P2W players because the money they spent getting to the "endgame" is wasted because they're basically told to do it again... for no reason.

author: @observer5393
text:
ğŸš© Red Flags: Why the Update Feels Exploitative and Unjustified
The upcoming Clash Royale Level 16 update has alarmed many long-time players. Beneath the surface of new rewards and cheaper mid-levels lies a familiar pattern of monetization-driven design that risks undermining years of player investment.
______________________________________
1. Level 16: The Vertical Progression Reset
Problem â€” Player Investment Devalued:
Introducing Level 16 instantly erases the sense of completion for fully maxed Level 15 accounts.
Psychological Play â€” Goalpost Shift:
This is a textbook â€œgoalpost reset.â€ Whales gain a new money sink, while competitive players must spend again just to retain parity.
Why Itâ€™s Unjustified:
A new level is worthwhile only when it adds gameplay depth â€” new mechanics, slots, or strategic layers. Level 16 delivers only higher stats, forcing players to pay to keep prior breakpoints intact.
______________________________________
2. Elite Wild Cards: Devaluation of a Trusted Currency
Problem â€” Loss of a Gold-Free Upgrade Path:
Elite Wild Cards once rewarded dedication by allowing upgrades without Gold. Converting them to Gems strips away that benefit.
Psychological Play â€” Resource Control:
By removing this independent currency and raising Gold costs (â‰ˆ 90 kâ€“120 k per upgrade), Supercell redirects spending to its most monetized bottleneck â€” Gold purchases or Gem conversions.
Result â€” A Double Monetization Hit:
Players lose a free resource while simultaneously facing a pricier new cap.
______________________________________
3. Mid-Level Cost Cuts: The Illusion of Generosity
Problem â€” Unequal Benefit:
Lowering upgrade costs for Levels 11â€“14 looks generous but mainly aids newcomers. Veterans who paid the old rates feel their earlier grind was wasted.
Psychological Play â€” Progressive Hook:
Cheaper mid-levels accelerate players into the mid-ladder, just before they encounter the steep new Level 16 wall. Once invested, theyâ€™re less likely to quit.
Why Itâ€™s Short-Sighted:
Long-term loyalty suffers when early adopters see their time and Gold retroactively devalued.

author: @DonutsRdelice
text: Abdod, I don't think you'll read this, but could you try and pull some strings (and I know they don't give you a lot of power, but at least ask on the player base's behalf) to make the ranked cap at level 11? everyone there is already basically maxed and has proven themselves to be able to overcome adversity (boosted spammers), and the competitive mode should be a completely fair opportunity to grow your skill with whatever deck you like. I think evolutions need to stay (they need people buying pass even at high ladder), but level 11 would be super sweet. A different idea would be to move all ranked rewards to 15K or higher (whatever the trophy road peak is) in high concentration, as well as exclusive seasonal emotes or something, so they can still incentivize trash players to buy stuff to level up to push, and change ranked so that there are no rewards and it is purely competitive. Pro players are still going to max for viewership, and then talented players who don't want to drop their life savings on a mobile game can still compete. If you read this, please lmk what you think of the idea (I liked the video if that helps :D).

author: @SkllSession
text:
It's absolutely insane that Supercell is one of the only companies to make a game so blatantly a cash grab, and yet so popular simply because there's NO high-quality alternative in stock. At least Valorant players have the argument that the predatory monetization gives NO advantage to players, and is solely cosmetic, but Clash Royale is the only game I know where it's so heavily incentivized to pay this much money for a game. Watch, everyone's gonna do the same thing they always do. They'll complain, they'll say the games going to die, and then they'll come crawling back because what are we going to play? Clash of Wizards? Champion Strike?

Supercell's been making crappy decisions with just about every game they've made for the past half-decade or so. Clash Mini? Gone. Beatstar? Gone. Clash of Clans? Probably some of the worst progression choices they've made in years. I've NEVER seen a company with this many games discontinued, just look at their wiki, outside their cash cows just about every project headed by them closed down. The day a good, HIGH QUALITY competitor to Clash Royale comes, it's going to kill this game. The primer's set, someone just needs to ignite it.

author: @LuizFe67
text:
I used AI to translate my text.
 I'm not very good writing in English cause it's not my first language, so It's helps me a lot:

If they really wanted to help new players progress, they shouldnâ€™t use Level 16 as an excuse, because there are so many better ways to do that. Plus, the majority of players donâ€™t even have a Level 15 deck yet. I donâ€™t either â€” my main deck is still missing two Level 15 cards, and thatâ€™s because of how hard it was to get EWC.

So yeah, they did something good by removing EWC, but for some fucking reason they added a new and completely useless level that realistically does nothing â€” and at the worst possible time. And letâ€™s not forget that all new and mid-level players will still need to reach Level 15 and 16, so it just doesnâ€™t make sense to me.
Itâ€™s like they canâ€™t do something good without balancing it out with something bad.

Itâ€™s even more questionable now since we donâ€™t have books anymore, and when you get cards you already own
maxed, you just get some cosmetic crap coin?! WTF. I already hate getting Level 14 and 15 cards â€” at least before they turned into EWC that were KINDA useful. (It give you so little that doesn't impact realistically, but it is still better than nothing...)
 For me it always made no sense to get cards that already are maxed lvl...


The reality is that theyâ€™ll always be GreedyCell, and theyâ€™re incapable of releasing a good update with actual content. All they do is recycle game modes, revive the dead Clash Mini in Clash royale, get rid of global tournaments (which probably will be gone for ever â€” Royale API said that, or at least I saw a screenshot on last Boss stream showing it).

And every time they add â€œnew content,â€ thereâ€™s always some pay-to-win cap, like new evolutions â€” considering how hard shards are to get. The new cards are ok, I guess, but only adding that is boring. Plus, we still have to upgrade them to even use them, which is ridiculously hard, so the update ends up being useless. Honestly, every update is trash...


I donâ€™t know if this game will ever be good again, because free-to-play players donâ€™t actually get to play the real game. Weâ€™re just grinding levels and cards so that one day we can finally use more options and ACTUALLY play strategically.
For most people, Clash Royale isnâ€™t a strategy game â€” itâ€™s just a grinding and leveling simulator.

author: @vtgalover8213
text:
I believe the next supercell game that needs to die is clash royal. And I want it to do because it genuinely hurts to see a game I beloved become so infested with tumors. Class Royal in its nature was always going to be not so free to play friendly but back in the day it was in a state where it can be tolerated but with new levels the tumors were showing then champions then evos sure there were some measures to â€œbalance itâ€ and while yes it didnâ€™t stop the tumors from growing it made it a bit more tolerable made it be a little bit less. But the tumors has grown beyond a point of no return where you consider that point is up to you, but I think for the players that are playing Iâ€™d hope that this is there tipping point that that the tumors has consumed what you love it is no longer recognizable itâ€™s time to put it down for good for its sake and for the players who put time into the game and loved it but are now just in pain or â€œpainâ€ looking at it. We saw supercell lose a game that went global (squad busters) now provided that was a newer game but it proves the giant can bleed and if that game which I canâ€™t say anything about fallen and I imagine with not too many tumors than if we band together we can bring down the tumor filled game together to allow it to rest for good. 

I do apologize for no pauses in that thing and using tumors as a metaphor for things, but itâ€™s the only way I felt I could describe my thoughts and how I feel about a game I once loved that becomes harder to look at every day.

author: @taivu3966
text: In clash of clans, you choose your opponent. That's mean new lvl = new playing ground, new strategy. In clan war, people with higher lvl rarely fight people with lower lvl to avoid wasting an attack. In clash royal however, you got match a guy with a deck full of lvl 16, there is nothing you can do other than spend to max your lvl. You can't choose who to attack, people with higher lvl than you basically have no downside. A win is a win no matter the lvl. Hence this is a punch in the face to f2p player

author: @Aspect_of_the_idiot
text:
As a mid ladder player the reason why I feel that CoC getting a new townhall level vs CR getting a new level feels more exciting has everything to do with gameplay. 
1. In CoC you aren't forced to go up against someone who has a level advantage, you can just move on and find a different base to raid, while in CR you are forced to play against a player who is higher level and that just feels so unfun to play against.
2. In CoC having a troop who's a level down doesn't feel as detrimental as in CR because at the end of the day it all depends on your strategy and troop placement while in CR interactions change completely if a card is down or up a level forcing you to spend more elixir or giving an advantage since you don't have to spend more elixir.
3. CR devs have been making progression feel worse because they keep adding these amazing things that help you progress or give you good rewards (books in this case) and removing them while in CoC they seem to give you more ways to obtain these items that help you progress faster without having to empty out your bank account. You totally can spend money but it doesn't feel as necessary as CR

I don't know what you can do to solve all these problems that I feel plague this game but for my 1st problem I thought of a possible solution and that is do what they do for challenges and have a level cap on every arena that way you can play on relatively equal footing against your opponent without feeling like shit, I'm in arena 20 and I can't climb anymore because my highest level of card is 13 and that's only on minion and skeleton king the rest are between 9-12 and I keep going up against players who have every single card 14-15, it just doesn't seem fair

author: @opp_goblin
text:
i donâ€™t wanna put words in your mouth, but i feel like you articulated your concerns about levels pretty poorly here. 

The main difference between clash of clans and clash royale is that oneâ€™s whole identity is centered around rewarding the grind, while the other is an actual competitive game that borderline requires it. 

when you have level ups in clash of clans, you have something to work towards. youâ€™re getting more tools at your disposal and you can feel the level change. you see all these new features that the next level has and you say â€œi want thatâ€. i remember being happy that i finally unlocked my first hero. the levels are actually rewarding and give you cool new toys in return for your progress.

with clash royale, though, youâ€™re not getting stronger, youâ€™re catching up. my level 15 mega knight doesnâ€™t feel stronger than my level 14 one does. levels (for top ladder at least) donâ€™t often give me a strategic advantage or extra power or extra features. they give me a FAIR CHANCE. thatâ€™s it. i donâ€™t want to level up my cards because itâ€™s just something i can do and itâ€™s satisfying, i do it because itâ€™s the ONLY WAY I CAN PLAY THE GAME AS IT WAS INTENDED. 

iâ€™ll never forget how many times iâ€™ve lost games to log bait because fire spirit tricking left goblins at 1 HP. and when i finally leveled them up to 15, i wasnâ€™t â€œhappyâ€, i was empty. i just blew a months worth of progress to fix (not get an advantage) ONE  interaction. 

iâ€™m sure supercell realizes this already but what fucking ever. this games going straight into the dumpster

text: 6:38 in clash of clans, when you battle, you get matched with people in similar townhalls. in clash royale, you will get matched with people in the same arena regardless of level. this makes it so a level 15 matching with a level 1 possible, which is insanely unfair. sure, it's basically impossible for a level 1 player to get to legendary arena, and there are very few people who will spend enough money to max out their cards at arena 1, but it is common for a level 11 to get matched with level 14 or 15, which may not seem like a big difference, but levels matter very much. imagine your log can't take out an opponent's goblin barrel, which would happen if the log was level 11 and the barrel was level 14.

author: @muizuim
text:
1) Getting from level 14 to 15 with elite cards was horrible so im glad they changed it (coming from someone with a maxed level 15 deck) but if they are going to capitalise on fixing their own progression by undoing any good they did by adding level 16 leaves a sweet and sour taste in our mouths. They are literally bundling the good with the bad to make it more digestible.

2) I think removing books because they do not provide value at lower levels makes sense but if new players without any books dont get the equivalent to a book from one drop or from frequent small drops of wild cards in the new system getting to level 15/16 will be the same slow slug fest elite cards were meaning there has been no real change other than the consistency of items.

3) I think having gems be useful could work but if the new prices are just marginally better than 250 gems for 5 epics then they are straight up robbers. For the new gem system to work they need to be great deals because people already assume spending gems on upgrades is a waste which it definitely is right now and always has been.

The heroic character is probably evo/champion/new card Mini Pekka. This has the potential to be a healthy update but based on what they have given us in the past they will probably continue to feed us poison and sell us the cure.

The second is that they are consistent with upgrade times for lower level player it does not change much considering lower town halls will be decreased and for the new players its consitently about 10 months and they know even if they do not pay they will be able to finish just slower. The last thing is that developers are honest about the updates and everyone knows well in advance what is happening .

author: @SublimeLemon101
text: One of the very niche things that may matter is the 50000 player xp gained from leveling card to lvl 15. This may be a huge underrated factor on whether to use elite wild cards before or after the update in my opinion. If you are just about at king level 15, there may be a potential benefit to actually spending elite wild cards purely based on the fact that you get 50000 exp in order to level up. This could matter as there is a king tower level dependent conversion of resources after the update.  The extra  conversions may be well worth it depending on if you have been saving your resources or not.  Additionally, if for some reason they do get rid of that xp (I consider it highly plausible considering Clash Royaleâ€™s past), that would mean potentially hundreds of thousands of xp lost. Considering the fact that King level 16 will be added as well, in may be worth looking into using elite wild cards to get a higher level. Additionally if you were to level cards up now, you wouldnâ€™t have to pay gold which may be an added bonus. I guess we will have to wait and see as we get more details tho.

author: @NoName_____1-n4n
text:
I mean... should we really be that surprised? Most of Clash Royale's revenue comes from progression, cards, gold, EWCs, Magic Items, etc. Level 16 was inevitable and here it is, in just 14 more days. But with what's coming, a complete rework to progression, more arenas, meaning better lucky drops and chests, gem economy changes, and a currency for maxed out players to get exclusive cosmetics?
Yeah, it does suck that we now have a new level, but at least they're making earlier progression for mid-game players easier (and I really think that most players are around that area anyway). But this is unfortunately how Supercell has to make revenue for CR. Cosmetics can't work, I mean, by 2023, CR were selling Tower Skins for just $2, and emotes and Merge Tactics skins are at absurd prices, (probably because their cosmetic team isn't that big), and Battle Banners are practically free.
Horizontal progression can't work (basically Gadgets and Hypercharges in Brawl Stars) because evolutions are enough, and having a "Card Power" for Mega Knight were it's immune to knockback or something would be annoying as hell.
I may be an optimistic CR player who purchases the pass every month, but if they're able to do the progression and gem economy reworks, crystals, and other additions right, then this update can go from bad, to tolerable, to even great. 
The Clash Royale Community as always been... hard to communicate with. I mean, they called the latest update a "nerf to progression" despite it adding 2 more evolutions shards to the usual 5. They're times were they should be vocal about certain additions, but just saying "P2W" or "Trash Update" is never going to tell Supercell how you feel, it's just blind rage. Probably how it's reflected in communication since Clash of Clans and its community are pretty much best friends, especially on Reddit, but Brawl Stars and Clash Royale are just dead silent, since one community is always angry, and other consists of people who don't even know how to read. (Fun Fact Brawl Stars players: Did you know that Brawl Stars NERFED Bling in Starr Drops, and other Loot Boxes?! Yeah! Instead of getting a petty 1000 Bling as a fallback from that Legendary, now, you get 200 Bling!!!! WOW, Such a W update, chat!)
Anyway, can't wait to see sneak peeks next week! Keep it up Abdod!

text:
As a f2p player I spent a shit ton of my hard earned gold, gems, books, and wildcards upgrading cards outside of my main deck to level 14 so that when I get them from lucky drops/chests they convert to elite wild cards and I can get my main deck to level 15 faster and cheaper.

Now none of this will matter and I'm stuck broke with level 14-15 cards that I can't upgrade because I built myself around the old system.

I think something devs don't necessarily realize is that changing the system constantly is worse than keeping it the same even when that system is slightly annoying.

text:
If Supercell wanted to change the gem system with level 15 still being the max, they could at least test the waters to see if it's healthy for the game. That is to say, if people were happy with the new gem economy making level 15 much easier to obtain, maybe fans wouldn't be as mad if Supercell did eventually add level 16. 

As for the current update plan, I just think there's just too many changes that could potentially lead to disaster. Weâ€™ll never know until itâ€™s released, but Iâ€™m fairly cynical.

(If it were up to me, they should just focus on cosmetics if they wanted to add monetization to the game but thatâ€™s just my opinion)

author: @ForgottenFafnir
text:
â€‹Â @KadeGuests-hs8hfÂ  Because its definitely not boring to lose, not through any skill or strategy from your opponent, but because their cards are literally better than yours.

Have you ever wonder why levels don't exist in other such card games? It's because its inherently unfair and unbalanced. They only exist in CR as a form of progression and, to a greater and greater extend, monetization.

If you want to bully a level 12 with level 15 cards, you can do Trophy Road. Ranked should allow everyone to be on the same level, both metaphorically and literally, so that skill and strategy is the defining factors in deciding how good you are at the game

author: @Ali_Alhakeem
text:
No joke this is actually a GOOD update ! 

The economy is SO BROKEN right now. :shelterin:
I'm f2p, have 16 books , 5 million gold, ton of gems and can't use ANY of them.
Books doesn't upgrade level 15 (you need elite cards) ,Gold has NO USE, like Litterally zero use for care above level 14 card, Gems aren't worth buying or using... you can't do anything valuable with them anymore, Magic coin is useless for lv14 too (no gold to upgrade).

Also elite wild cards just sucks and confusing i'm so happy they are removed them.
Now you need WAY less cards per upgrade, gold now has actual use, our books are converted to cards and gems instead of sitting there with no use, they actually fixed the economy, they could've done it better but it's better than what we currently have.

7:47 maybe it wont change much for matches where both players are maxed, but the sudden change of level cap will affect players in high arenas whose cards are only lvl14 (f2p players), maybe they'll manage to get some cards to lvl 15 but most players who ALREADY were ahead of them with all their cards at lvl 15 will get to lvl 16 way earlier, since they have more gold and more gems, 1 level is a huge difference, now imagine if it was 2 levels. 

And on top of that, i still believe cards health bars need a rework since some cards (Pekka i'm looking at you) have way more health than others and that is not reflected on their hp bar, making it harder to know when a tanky card is going to die by tower damage or you actually need to use another card/spell to ensure it won't reach your tower. imagine a level 16 pekka going to your lvl 14 tower, the pekkaÂ´s hp bar is barely visible, only a sliver of health left, but since your tower is 2 levels lower the pekka manages to hit your tower once, maybe twice, that makes the level gap matter even more

author: @ooohyeahfreshwater
text:
Clash of Clans: LOW INDIVIDUAL CONTROL and lot of things to upgrade

Brawl Stars: HIGH INDIVIDUAL CONTROL and levels upgrades are linear (so the status difference are less impactful on the high and more expensive levels)

Clash Royale: MEDIUM CONTROL and levels growth exponentially. The gameplay is most based on the INTERACTION between card, so an over leveling can change completely some important interactions!

Besides you have an advantage in the other games, I never felt it so hard as in CR. 

Upgrading cards is BORING! I canâ€™t outskill my opponent to make a Nlv Log kill his N+1lv princess! 

Itâ€™s hard to make a system in this game that promotes an engagement to level up without making it unfairâ€¦

author: @GhostKingBS
text:
Level upgrade of Brawl Stars was the WORST

After that update in 2021 brawl stars started to fell down in popularity and seriously damaged the games gameplay 
It took 1 year to fix gears because back then it was not only to get new to levels
But it was even worse to upgrade new abilities gears not hypercharges
Hypercharges was implemented a bit later to make leveling up more meaningful and god it was a way better options than gears which made gameplay complex not in a good way
Mostly it took away the simplicity of brawl stars
And made it complex not in a good way 

Just imagine how many interactions would have changed in clash royale if you could give 2 different type of buffs out of 5 for each card
Where a card would have 
-more hp
-more damage when low
-and 50% ressistance for slowing, stun and knockback abilities (yes we had it in brawl stars and it was almost useless)

And did i mentioned that each ability has its own currency for unlocking and upgrading it

Some gear abilities  were way better than the others and later they changed gears in a way that you could buy them for coins without any other currency and we got new type of gears for some brawlers which worked like starpowers


Funny enough that after hypercharge addition they slowed down and then stopped adding new unique gears for brawlers

author: @KingKAlvo
text:
one of the main reasons that new TH levels in Clash of Clans are actually exciting is because they add new stuff, either enriching already established mechanics or adding completely new mechanics

the problem with new levels in Clash Royale is that not only do they not add anything meaningful gameplay-wise, but they are also problematic in the terms of card interactions

another thing is that everytime they add a new TH lvl, it comes along with significant reductions and the new TH gets just slightly higher

the reductions in the CR card levels are not only very small, but maxing yourself is overall more expensive because of the severely decreased rewards you get by playing normally (or even try harding challenges, which will now not be that good of an option since gems now are gonna be used for cards)

author: @nonmagicalwitch
text: And Clash of Clans entire idea is slowly building out your Village. It's non-direct pvp, which not only takes away a lot of the frustration of having to fight someone higher levelled than you, the star system means anything but a 0 Star is counted as a win. You can go in, beat 50% of someones Village, steal some of their loot and both of you are happy. The attacked has defended themselves from a 2 or 3 star and the attacker can use the loot they've collected to strenghten their village. It's not a zero-sum game. Clash Royale on the other hand is a zero-sum game, to the point where you lose exactly as many trophies as the one who has beat you gained. This means not only that the game is prone to toxicity, but also that level differences are an actual unfair advantage instead of just a minor hinderance. That's the reason I actually liked the ranked mode until they got rid of the level caps. I loved playing Challenges because you could very easily upgrade all your cards to lvl. 9 and have fun with them. This is just again baffling to see how an extremely f2p friendly game like CoC is from the same Studio as Cr

author: @garrettforman5407
text: The main issue with leveling up in CR is that there is really no difference between the levels. Just more health and damage and that's it. There is no gameplay changes between the levels. In COC there is, You get new towers, new troops, visual changes to your base and most importantly gameplay changes. Plus there is less of a need to get to the next Town Hall because you can still play the game at an equal playing level to other players. With CR you need to be the same level as others to make it feel fair. I don't think there is a really solution to the level system in CR. IT's just to pad the game and at PTW. But just removing gameplay because it "just doesn't feel right" is stupid. You can still buy elite cards in the shop right now. If you wanted to be honest and fair to your fan base you would at least say something about the change and stop taking peoples money.

In a serious note they could make it like clash of clans . You start at king level 1 and have few cards with the maximum level being level 1. author: @aimgo6440
text:
They did the best they could, but Level 16 simply doesnâ€™t move the game forward at all. Itâ€™s the exact same thing as every other level increase, and the only real effect is bringing back bigger level gaps â€“ basically more pay-to-win. Golden trash is still trash.

On top of that, they said about a year ago that there wouldnâ€™t be a Level 16.

It honestly feels like Supercell is trying to turn Clash Royale into Clash of Clans: releasing a new level every year so players always have something to upgrade. But that just doesnâ€™t work here. In CoC, people play for progression, you can skip overleveled enemies, and your village constantly changes as you upgrade. Clash Royale is completely different. Nobody plays CR for the levels â€“ they only cause frustration when someone wins unfairly because they paid more.

Supercell really needs to add actual premium skins to Clash Royale so they donâ€™t have to rely on updates like this anymore.

author: @Giannopsyrras
text:
If this is the final level before they actually start focusing on making money through cosmetics,which seems like they are gonna try to,then it's a worthy sacrifice.

But you cannot ingore how much it looks like they have just lifted the soft cap that they placed om themselves 2Â½ years ago,and decided to go back to just giving everyone new levels to grind when they see that enough people have upgraded their collection to a certain point.

Like,there was a small reason to celebrate lvl 15,because they made it SEEM like the final level,so at least we wouldn't get any more.

The removal of books also has a valid reason,but at the same time,I think just because of how satisfying it is to use one for full value,they should've kept them and tried to make them fit in the new economy.It generally is one of the few times you're extremely happy you can upgrade a card.

That being said,my peanut brain didn't want to look at the numbers you showed because they were all in black and white,so Idk how much worse the amount of cards and gold needed will be.

Either way,they're not a full economy breakdown,which I would really look forward to as a sneak peek.

text:
i'm a player who had played for a while a few years back, had half of my deck lv 14. I came back a few months ago and have been playing actively. 

This game's progression is broken for f2p. I have finally 6 evo shards after months of play (I had stopped playing trophy road since at 8.5K everyone has an evo and it made the difference in too many matches for me to not care). And I don't have a single level 15. I had resigned to never max my account, but maybe my whole active deck could be maxed in around a year. Now i'm just never gonna be maxxing anything in my whole life. Imagine joining this game now, it would take you a decade of active play to max an account, and by that time lv17 or lv18 will already be there.

author: @griffo73
text:
Â @omaribrahim3238Â  Heres some quick math for you :

Upgrading a common from level 1 to 12 takes 4087 cards. 12-13 is 3000 and 13-14 is 5000. The last two non "elite" levels combined is DOUBLE the combined amount it takes for lv 12. Meaning that level 1-12 is actually 30% of the way to level 14. A F2P account with mostly level 12 cards is not getting to level 16 anytime soon

author: @TomorrowNobody
text: Marvel snap is the answer. They Speedrun killing a game with greed. Adding special game modes and telling players to use the shop associated with that game mode and then literally not giving enough currency to use the shop without real money, selling broken new cards for $99 and then nerfing them the week after they are out of the shop, constant reworks that placed additional financial burden on anyone wanting to be competitive all while not addressing the actual issues that the game has with UI and collection levels. Sad to say they got me for thousands. I just got back into clash royale last month and was having fun but now I'm looking at that same shit I left behind in marvel snap.

author: @poleve5409
text:
Â @Ironfire0812Â  90% of players are f2p, they refuse to spend money on the game. And when you don't spend money, you're low level, and you have a hard time against other players. It's not fun when a game that should be skill based relies so much on your in-game resources.

As for evolutions, when they were first added they had stat boosts which made them just an objectively better version of a troop. Now that evolutions are easy to get and they don't have stat boost (with some exceptions), they're hated less. But anyway, evolution hate is nowhere on the same level as the hate when adding a new level. that's a very bad comparison.

author: @LazoGT
text: yeah this is the thing. theres absolutely 0 benefit for the players when it comes to level updates like this. there are no new interactions, just that every stat goes up 10% which doesn't do anything if both sides are the same level. in clash of clans getting a new town hall level (if done right) is awesome. you get new troops, new buildings, new heroes, new mechanics, so much stuff that mostly enhances gameplay. but wtf does it do in clash royale? it's just a big middle finger every time there's a level cap increase.

author: @japderby9990
text:
Â @wienerschnitzel1739Â  Level 13 should and always be the final level, any kind of extra level post official for CR is pure bullsh*t. 

Unlike Brawl Stars where they can "justify" having new level with new mechanic, Clash Royale progression system is so slow that if you lock any new mechanic behind new level then majority of playerbase even including veteran won't be able to use it. That's why extra level in this game is just for them draining our wallet and wasting our time even more with nothing in return. 

You grind more, you pay more to maintain the exact same interaction and experience you've once have with lower level cap. Because suddenly now level 15 is underleveled, you have to pay more just to be the same as before, nothing new  

This apply to every extra level they've ever introduce including level 14

author: @nicjoy4407
text:
As someone who regularly played/plays squad busters, I just don't agree.

The problem with squad busters was almost never pay to win progression. For a short time it was keys, but those were removed pretty quickly. Squad buster's issues have always been about how long the content drought is. It would take them 2 or so months to add literally anything, and the updates were usually relatively small, getting smaller and smaller over time leading up to 2.0.

The progression right after global was pretty bad, but that wasn't a p2w issue. Even if you paid, the progression was just so slow.
