text: Clash royale is easily the worst game I've ever played by a landslide. I deleted my account months ago and honestly I don't regret it at all. Specially seeing the path it's going down now. I don't understand how people can have the willpower to wake up and play this rng based crap developed by greedy people who only really want your money. The only time clash was ever fun for me was in 2017 when I played it with friends at sleepovers, but literally any game was fun in that setting so it's not really anything remarkable. Hunter, you said in one of your recent videos that you have 200 days of back to back clash Royale play time. To me, that's unfathomable. Just thinking that I had like 500 hours wasted in this game is bad enough. You clearly like it more than I ever did though and you're like, actually good, so you do you obviously. But MAN I'm so glad it's no longer a part of my life and I really am not surprised level 16 is in the game hahahah.

text:
Yeah but all the ytbers and ppl that spent money for lvl 15 will do the same for lvl 16, nothing will change and Supercell will get away with it again, I remember Ryley saying that he maxed his secondary acc (i don't remember if it was for lvl 15 tho) saying he sees it as "an inversion" because HE MUST have his cards to max lvl if he wanted to push his acc really far (you can see where this is going), thing that wouldn't be possible for a f2p player that can't even max a deck without it being absolute trash because Supercell keeps releasing op cards that, again, ytbers and some dumb ppl will buy so they can use no brainer decks.

So now momo and all the pros will have to max all of the cards so they can play this scammy game properly? 
I'm not a pro but I have 44 cards lvl 15 (yeah, f2p, I play since beta, just bought the pass ONCE for the pekka tower skin, I didn't get an op evo nor a car that is an absolute unit) and 111 cards lvl 14, the rest are 13, 12 and so on, and now you are telling me I will have to grind AGAIN to get lvl 16? I got 4 champions maxed and let me tell you that getting 20 mf champion wild cards was a nightmare, you only get like 3 champion wild cards per month and you have to PRAY for the lucky drops to give you something that isn't 45k gold.

This game is cooked, the sad thing is that nothing will change but I really don't know why am I still looking forwards a phone game, this situation is really sad, F U Supercell and the people inside it that does this things to the most loyal player base, that when things like this keeps happening we didn't do more than trust again.

Supercell keeps saying these updates are for the players, but if thatâ€™s really the case, then do everything else youâ€™re doing except adding another level.

Like seriously, whatâ€™s the point of another level? The whole game is based on how cards interact, and that balance is maintained through balance changes â€” not by adding more levels. The only thing higher levels do is make the game more unfair for anyone with lower-level cards.

If you actually cared about the players, youâ€™d think about removing levels altogether (obviously not gonna happen) instead of adding more. You say itâ€™s for players with maxed accounts, but letâ€™s be real â€” nobody who just finished maxing their cards, whether by grinding or paying, is wishing for another level. It just feels like youâ€™re making up reasons to do what you want, not whatâ€™s best for the players.

author: @tortue_
text:
Proud of you to call it scummy openly. Where they stand on this game feels soulless. No love shown to the game, no care for it. They just pump out broken evos each season then nerf that and add the next one... I just can't with these people man. It's been years, I've been telling myself the same thing for years and years and years. This game has so much potential and it is just P2W. I wish there was competition.

 Overwatch 2 was really badly monetized at it's start as well and Activision-Blizzard been bought by Microsoft, the CEO has changed, Marvel Rivals was a huge competition. They fixed most of the issues. As a F2P in that game I can get any cosmetic I want minus the ones in the shop but if I get lucky (I did) I can get them from Lootboxes. They gave out like hundreds of those with events. 

Too bad Marvel Rivals shot themselves in the foot doing all the mistakes OW2 had in its inception. Like extremely high dmg and healing etc. The characters are supposed to be different and unique yet all the supports have the same ultimate, too many dps heroes and boring tanks. I played Groot and there is so much intricate inner workings of that hero it is crazy fun. I wish they would stop f-ing around and actually developed the game instead of releasing gooner skins and heroes.

author: @SprocketSAB
text:
Honestly, watching this Clash Royale YouTuber play feels like a masterclass disguised as entertainment. The way they break down every interactionâ€”from elixir trades to micro-timing on placementsâ€”shows a level of awareness that most players donâ€™t even realize exists. They donâ€™t just play the game; they read it like a living story, predicting pushes before they happen and adjusting their strategy with a calm confidence that makes every match feel like a showcase of pure, calculated brilliance. Even when the opponent throws out something chaotic or unexpected, they handle it with a kind of smooth adaptability that makes impossible defenses look effortless and risky counterpushes look artfully planned.

What makes them stand out even more is the way they explain their thought process while still keeping the energy light, funny, and genuinely enjoyable. They never talk down to their audienceâ€”instead, they uplift them, teaching complex ideas in a way that feels natural and exciting. Their content has this perfect balance: high-level gameplay for the competitive fans, clear tips for newer players, and charismatic personality for everyone in between. Itâ€™s the kind of channel you can watch for hours without getting bored because every video feels like a combination of skill, creativity, humor, and passion.

On top of all that, the editing, pacing, and overall presentation show just how much care goes into every upload. Itâ€™s obvious theyâ€™re not just hitting â€œrecordâ€ and hoping for the best; theyâ€™re crafting something worth watching. Whether theyâ€™re trying out off-meta decks, climbing ladder with insane precision, or taking on challenges that look impossible until they magically make them work, they bring a uniqueness that sets them apart from every other creator in the Clash Royale community.

In short, theyâ€™re not just a good Clash Royale YouTuberâ€”theyâ€™re one of those rare creators who make the game more exciting, more accessible, and more inspiring for everyone who watches. Their content elevates the entire community, and itâ€™s genuinely a pleasure to see someone bring that much skill, personality, and creativity to every single match they play.

author: @CaptainPrice.141
text: Dude the Knight hero needs a nerf already, a taunt ability is way too OP. Doesn't matter what deck you throw him in it's always going to be insanely strong. Log bait? Taunt the troops countering your barrel. Beatdown? Taunt the tank-killer or building away from your tank. Siege? Taunt the troops attacking your siege building. Hog cycle? Taunt the troop or building countering your hog. It doesn't matter. You can taunt any troop away from your win condition. Taunting shouldn't be a thing in Clash Royale, it ruins a core mechanic. Especially if it's only going to be 1 elixir.

 * Gems will be used to help upgrade cards to the next level [00:00].
 * The gem cost varies by card rarity:
   * Champion Cards: Upgrading one from level 15 to 16 with gems costs 6,000 gems. Upgrading one entirely with gems costs 16,800 gems total [02:18].
   * Legendary Cards: Upgrading one from level 15 to 16 costs 4,200 gems. Upgrading one from level 9 all the way to 16 costs 14,270 gems [02:30].
   * Common, Rare, and Epic Cards:
     * Until a card reaches level 8, every upgrade costs 100 gems in total [02:43].
     * Upgrading a Common card from level 14 to 15 costs 2,000 gems [03:08].
     * Upgrading a Rare card from level 14 to 15 costs 2,100 gems [03:15].
     * Upgrading an Epic card from level 14 to 15 costs 2,500 gems [03:23].
 * The gem price automatically adapts to the number of cards you already own [03:38].
Chests and Evolutions
 * Magic Lucky Chests now come with levels (up to level 16) depending on your arena, and the quantity of cards increases with the chest level [00:29].
 * The focus in Magic Lucky Chests is now on cards and wild cards. Books, wild shards, and elite wild cards are gone from these chests [00:48].
 * Evolution Boxes are the main source of evolutions and come in three rarities: Epic (single random shard), Legendary (up to two shards), and Champion (a full evolution) [01:04].
Pass Royale Rework
 * Hero Pass Royale is unlocked above 5,000 trophies and features a brand new hero for December (Hero Mini Pekka) [01:20].
 * If you are below 5,000 trophies, your pass contains six wild evolution shards instead [01:36].
 * The main rewards across the pass are now wild cards [02:00]. An evolution shard has been moved earlier to Tier 20 [01:52].
Elite Wild Cards and Magic Books
 * The video advises the creator's personal choice to spend elite wild cards now before the conversion rates are revealed because the high-level gem costs are very expensive [03:54].
 * The video suggests to save Magic Books, as their conversion value is acceptable. The only exception is if you are already level 15, in which case using a Book of Books might be fine since the conversion gives 6,000 gems (enough for a Champion from 15 to 16) [04:25].
 * Remember to save unclaimed rewards from Pass Royale, Ranked, and Trophy Road for a small early boost when the update drops [04:46].
